name: Heirophant of the Cabal: Druid 37 / CoT2/ Monk1
author: grizzled_dwarflord

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
The "Hierophants of the Cabal" is a group of 9 Grand Druids that have never been beaten by an aspiring Great Druid. The purpose of the Cabal is to maintain the Cosmic Order, and the Hierophants provide constant vigil to see that the Grand Scheme of the Multiverse is not defeated by those who seek the ascendancy of extremes. The Hierophants carefully measure the flow of the land and seek to preserve the delicate balance between Law and Chaos, Good and Evil, ensuring that no one gains too much strength to tip the Balance.

Heirophant of the Cabal


Nothing groundbreaking here, just my interpretation of the most powerful caster druid in all creation.  10 Great Wisdom feats are non-negotiable, as is Dragon Shape for melee presence, Monk for AC and Evasion, ESF: Conjuration to absolutely crush your opponents with Grease/Stonehold/Storm of Vengeance, and still maintain 41st level penetration power.  A bit munchkin-ed, yes, but that was the point.

Player’s Commentary
There’s something uniquely satisfying for me in a caster Druid.  Often considered the red-headed stepchild of the caster classes, nothing could be further from the truth.  They are no arcane trebuchets, true, but their power comes from a different place.  Grease and Extended Grease is one of the best spells in the game, and the Druid has this in spades.  Indeed, that’s really the only reason to take Extended Spell at all in this arrangement is for the Extended Greases.  Meld this with Stonehold and now you are forcing your opponents to make Reflex and Will saves every round.  Failing either will cause them to fall down and/or be encased in stone, or both.  Once you have this maneuver enabled, now you can take your time about how you destroy them.  Storm of Vengeance? Sure.  Zen archery pew pew? Check.  Summons and Companions? Why not. Empowered Ice Storms and Call Lightnings? Easy money. Pimp-slap some Harms? Done.  Or truly diabolical? Infernos and Extended Infernos and drink and Invis potion.
 
Dragon Shape is there as well, for when you either run out of spells or found an opponent who can overcome your spells.
 
Some may ask, “Why the 2 Penetration feats? You’re a 37th level caster with Nature’s Balance! You’ll demolish Toolset SR like a hot axe through butter!” Indeed, if you are confining and consigning yourself to playing the OCs and offline mods, then you probably should swap them out for BF and Toughness (or Maximize and Scribe Scroll, etc).  But if you are playing anywhere serious, know that SR goes above the default toolset values, and Monk SR cannot be lowered by Nature’s Balance.  Would  you get more use and value out of a couple other feats.  Sure, most likely.  But consider it an insurance policy.  If you want to be the most powerful, you have to beat SR in all shapes and sizes.
 
Similar Builds
Many of the builds that go this deep in Druid level seem to focus on Dragon, but I will single them all out.  The following are taken from the Search Engines from the New Guild and the Old.
  •  Elementalist Spellcaster, by GhostNWN.  40th level druid.  The Heirophant is stronger.
  •  Iconic Druid (sorta) by MartinJHolmm Druid38/Ftr1/Monk1.  There are a number of issues in this build.
  •  Divine Exclamation by Thax’, a Druid37/Assn2/Monk1.  This build is closest to the Heiro in that it, too, is a caster build.  Main differences – he’s evil, spends 3 feats on Evocation which I tend to shy from as a player, doesn’t get max Wisdom, and no Dragon Shape.
  • Nature’s Defender, by Talamier, Druid36/Monk2/SD2, a not-so-optimized HiPSing dragon.
  • Silvanite Shadewood Mistress, by kevinxiaowis, Druid36/Monk2/SD2, another HiPSing dragon.
  •  The Witch, by Aligory, Druid37/Rogue1/SD2.  Another caster druid (yay!).  But no Monk, no dragon shape as back-up, questionable feat choices, and not as powerful as the Heirophant.
  • The Skilled and Sneaky Draconian Arch-Druid [SSD] (Druid 36/Monk 1/Rogue 3). Sneaky indeed, while this is a dragon build, make no mistake he is a caster druid as well.  And has 100 more skill points.  Great build.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
TheSquid wrote: ↑
Aug 28, 2021
I wonder, have you thought about getting a second monk level pre-epic for +2 to all saves? You lose 1 AB and one caster level, but that seems worthwhile to me. And not having to wait for level 37 to get some monk boni is nice too.
You can do that and not affect the integrity of the build. The only loss is 1 AB ranged/melee and 1 penetration power, so 40th level vs 41st (but I want it to go to 11!). The other caveat is that adding the Monk pre-epic does not give a +2 save bump in that scenario, it gives a +1 Fort, +2 Reflex, +1 Will bump, because Druid 20 gets their last Fort/Will increase.  Still noteworthy, though.  I would call that the working man's version!
Mick Dagger wrote:Skills
(Normally I would ask for a skills schedule - but here with 37 Druid levels I think things are quite obvious. And you also point out that things are not set in stone so to speak)
Yes, it's a fairly easy skill split.  Max out discipline and Spot on CoT level ups, Discipline, Concentration, Tumble and sprinkle in some Hide/Move Silently on Monk, and Druid levels are Concetration, Spellcraft and whatever else you want really.
